reasoning.correctness: Gold Answer precisely cites symptoms (dry cough P-1/P-14, SOB P-1/P-19, wheezing P-15, chest tightness P-20), asthma history (P-2/D-3), exact bronchodilator escalation (P-8: once/2wks to 5-6/wk), wheezing more frequent than use (P-17), triggers (P-9/P-11), and infection screening negatives (P-14/P-21-P-28). Generated covers symptoms with partial citations but omits exact frequency increase (vaguely references P-1/P-9 instead of P-8), misses wheezing frequency detail, infection screening, and precise history; includes minor errors like citing cold air to P-1 (actually P-9/P-11) and adds family history emphasis not central to Gold. Main point of worsening asthma correct, but significant discrepancies on key quantified increase and differentials.
reasoning.completeness: Gold key points: all 4 symptoms with cites, dx history, bronchodilator relief/escalation specifics, wheezing freq > use, triggers, full infection screen negatives. Generated covers 3/4 symptoms (notes chest tightness absence), vague escalation, partial triggers, dx implied but not detailed; misses precise freqs, wheezing/use comparison, infection screen (crucial for 'vs new condition'), med adjustment hint. Covers ~50-60% of points.
reasoning.faithfulness: Claims grounded: symptoms P-1/P-15 accurate; bronchodilator helps P-1 yes; triggers P-9/P-11 (cites partly wrong P-1); family P-32 verifiable. Unverifiable/hallucinated: 'Knowledge Graph' links multiple times (absent from transcript); chest tightness 'standard' without transcript cite (exists P-20 but notes absence); escalation details not fully cited/accurate. Multiple hallucinations via external KG references and citation errors.
reasoning.relevance: Directly addresses question by affirming symptom combo + increased use indicate asthma worsening vs new condition; lists specified symptoms and escalation; minor off-topic (family history, KG). Perfectly focused overall with small tangents.

summary: The Generated Answer captures the core conclusion and main symptoms but lacks precision on key quantified details, omits critical differential evidence, and introduces transcript-external hallucinations, resulting in moderate performance.
